p: The opioid receptor-like 1 (ORL-1), recently named NOP, was identified in 1994 as a G-protein-coupled receptor that has a high degree of amino acid sequence homology to classic opioid receptors (δ, μ, and κ) [ 85, 86, 87]. As an endogenous ligand of ORL-1, Nociceptin/orphanin (N/OFQ) is a peptide that initiates its function and is involved in pain regulation, cognition, anxiety and the cardiovascular system [ 88, 89, 90, 91, 92, 93, 94].
